title: I am 19. I like listening to kpop. I think I am ok at dancing but not good at singing. Should I try auditioning for kpop? - Quora

response.answer_text: Basically, you need to understand at least basic or intermediate level Korean to sing most K-pop songs pretty good if you must sing these songs in Korean. One of the most popular K-pop songs was Gangnam Style - also known as “Oppan Gangnam Style” - by Psy. On first hearing of this “Oppan” song, you hear all of that Korean gibberish, before Psy says in English “Gangnam Style”, but if you want to really understand this Korean, you need to know the written Korean transliteration, and also get a basic understanding of the character writing of Korea, called Hungul. Also, it is best to take a taekwondo class or learn some taekwondo lingo from Korea, where the martial art is born. Especially understand the Korean numbers used in taekwondo because sometimes, you will need the number knowledge to count off before a K-pop song totally in Korean. Here is an example of numbers used in Korean…… Il - (“eel”) - means first Yi - (“yee”) - means second.

You can always try but you might be dissapointed in the end if it’s your dream go for it but singing is really really important in K-Pop Aren’t we all tired of groups who lipsync rather than have actual talent plus you have to sing while dancing which makes it harder if your voice is really horrible you won’t have really high chances if you can rap maybe you have luck However if your voice is good but not the best, you’ll get better by training Don’t give up and fighting!
